Description: The sheet "Promoters vs Detractors (2019)" in the "Consolidated Cookbook" workbook in the "Default" project on the "890Portal" site compares people metrics for detractors and promoters. The data is sourced from the "Sheet1" table in the "Claim Data.xlsx" database using the "excel-direct" connection. There is only one column in the table named "Detractor/Promoter". Further details about the data and its analysis cannot be determined without additional information.

The sheet named "Y-o-Y CSAT Comparison" in the dashboard "Comparison of People Metrics" compares the customer satisfaction (CSAT) scores of an organization and the industry as a whole over the years. The data is sourced from the Sheet1 of the NPS Metrics.xlsx database and has three columns - CSAT (Org), CSAT (Industry), and Year. The sheet visualizes the data to show the trend in CSAT scores for the organization and the industry, allowing for easy comparison between the two.

The sheet "Cycle Times on Insurance Claim" in the workbook "Consolidated Cookbook" provides data on the cycle times and IDs of insurance claims. The data is sourced from the "Claim Data" Excel file, specifically from the "Sheet1" tab. The sheet has 2 columns, named "CYCLE TIME" and "ID", and the table name is also "Sheet1". The dashboard that this sheet is a part of is called "Comparison of People Metrics" and is located in the "Default" project on the "890Portal" site.

The sheet "Rural/Urban Distribution (2019)" in the Tableau dashboard "Comparison of People Metrics" presents data on the urbanicity of individuals in a dataset called "Claim Data". The data is sourced from a database called "Claim Data.xlsx" and the connection to this database is made directly through an Excel connection. The sheet contains one column named "URBANICITY" which categorizes individuals as either living in an urban or rural area. The purpose of this sheet is to provide a visual comparison of the distribution of individuals living in urban and rural areas within the dataset.

The sheet named "Y-o-Y NPS Comparison" in the workbook "Consolidated Cookbook" compares the Net Promoter Scores (NPS) of an organization with the NPS of the industry for different years. The data is sourced from a datasource named "Sheet1 (NPS Metrics)" which is connected to an Excel file named "NPS Metrics.xlsx" using a direct connection named "excel-direct". The sheet has three columns named "Year", "NPS (Org)", and "NPS (Industry)" and the table name for all three columns is "Sheet1". The sheet provides a comparison of the NPS of the organization with the NPS of the industry over time.
